greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of sets of rooted hypertrees on a total of n unlabeled nodes with a total of k edges, (0 <= k < n).
comment: Equivalently, the number of sets of rooted connected graphs on a total of n unlabeled nodes with a total of k blocks where every block is a complete graph.
Bivariate Euler transform of triangle A318602.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
example: Case n=3: There are 5 sets of rooted graph which are illustrated below (an x marks a root node). These have 0, 1, 1, 2, 2 blocks so row 3 is 1, 2, 2.
x   x    x   x    x---o    x---o    x---o
program: (PARI) \\ here EulerMT is Euler transform (bivariate version).
EulerMT(u)={my(n=#u, p=x*Ser(u), vars=variables(p)); Vec(exp( sum(i=1, n, substvec(p + O(x*x^(n\i)), vars, apply(v->v^i,vars))/i ))-1)}
A(n)={my(v=[1]); for(i=2, n, v=concat([1], EulerMT(y*EulerMT(v)))); [Vecrev(p) | p <- EulerMT(v)]}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 30 2018
